references.paper_title: Controlling the false discovery rate via knockoffs
references.reason: This paper introduces the foundational Model-X knockoff framework, a crucial method for controlling the false discovery rate in feature selection which is the central topic of the current paper.

references.paper_title: Panning for gold: 'Model-X' knockoffs for high dimensional controlled variable selection
references.reason: This paper significantly extends the knockoff framework to high-dimensional settings, directly addressing the challenges of modern datasets that are high-dimensional and have a large number of features.

This paper pioneers the use of deep learning in knockoff generation, providing a more flexible and powerful approach compared to traditional parametric methods, which is a key innovation that this paper expands upon.
This paper improves upon existing deep learning-based knockoff methods by directly maximizing the likelihood, thus enhancing the quality and efficiency of the generated knockoffs.

This paper addresses a critical limitation of previous knockoff methods by introducing the concept of reconstructability and showing that reducing reconstructability leads to improved power, which this paper directly tackles.
